content:
The Linear Algebra Game is currently at Lean 3.51.1. Are there any projects working on porting it to the new lean4 game maker? If not, would it be as simple as running mathport on the project to convert the structures/thm/proofs, fixing technical mistakes, and then converting it to the lean4 game format (adding doc/hints/etc.)?

Just playing around with it, I've run leanproject build it on it and encountered errors with lemmas having the same name so ig a little processing needs to be done beforehand.

Generally the lean3 games had a quite different structure. For the NNG I originally just did a manual port: The maths in there is simple enough that I just copy-pasted all levels manually into the "GameSkeleton"-template and fixed the tactic proofs (semi-) manually.

I'd assume that would be a reasonable approach for other lean3-games, too.

Especially you want to spilt up the long text-paragraphs of the lean3-game into small goal-dependent hints, which has to happen manually anyways.
George Chemmala has marked this topic as resolved.
